condition.name: condition
condition.description: Apply this condition to the collection query. This is essentially like a SQL WHERE clause, e.g. firstname='Ben'

date_range.name: date_range
date_range.description: Start and End dates to search, in seconds since Jan 1, 1970, as a comma-separated list. Start (index 0 in the array) is inclusive, End (index 1) is exclusive. Either or both can be empty.

externs.name: externs
externs.description: External fields to include in results

group_ids.name: group_ids
group_ids.description: Array of Group ID for Object type as comma-delimited list

listFields.name: listFields
listFields.description: Return only these fields in the response

searchNotes.name: searchNotes
searchNotes.description: Boolean flag to additionally search Object Notes for the Search term given in Search parameter

sortDir.name: sortDir
sortDir.description: Sort direction, must be used in conjunction with sort parameter.

start.name: start
start.description: Return results starting at this offset

delay.name: delay
delay.description: Days to delay start of offer.

offer_id.name: offer_id
offer_id.description: This must be a valid Offer ID.

order_id.name: order_id
order_id.description: This must be a valid Order ID.

shipping_charge_reoccurring_orders.name: shipping_charge_reoccurring_orders
shipping_charge_reoccurring_orders.description: Add shipping charge to reoccurring orders?

id.name: id
id.description: This must be an existing Product ID.

quantity.name: quantity
quantity.description: How many of this product are being purchased?

setup_fee_date.name: setup_fee_date
setup_fee_date.description: Date to charge setup fee (when setup_fee_when is "on_date").

setup_fee_when.name: setup_fee_when
setup_fee_when.description: When should setup fee be applied?

shipping.name: shipping
shipping.description: Does this product have an associated shipping cost?

total.name: total
total.description: What is the total amount of this sale?

trial_period_count.name: trial_period_count
trial_period_count.description: Length of trial period (also set trial_period_units).

trial_period_unit.name: trial_period_unit
trial_period_unit.description: Units describing length of trial period.

id.name: id
id.description: ID of the Shipping Method to apply. This must be an existing Shipping Method.

TaskCompleteParams.name: TaskCompleteParams
TaskCompleteParams.description: Criteria and data of the Tasks to complete.

outcome.name: outcome
outcome.description: Task outcome name. This must start with ":=" For example, ":=signed".

task_form_data.name: task_form_data
task_form_data.description: These fields can be used to update associated Object data when completing a task. For example, set task_form_title to "New title" to change the Contact's title.

due_date.name: due_date
due_date.description: Due date of new Task, given as number of days from current date.

message_id.name: message_id
message_id.description: Message ID of new Task to be created for further followup. This Task must currently exist. New tasks can be created using the Objects Create endpoint with objectID=1.

id.name: id
id.description: ID of the Tax to apply. This must be an existing Tax type.

chargeNow.name: chargeNow
chargeNow.description: Charge Transaction now or or just log a Transaction.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: Create new Transaction for this Object instance (Contact ID).

gateway_id.name: gateway_id
gateway_id.description: Gateway ID to use for this Transaction.

invoice_template.name: invoice_template
invoice_template.description: Invoice ID to use for this Transaction.

trans_date.name: trans_date
trans_date.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds since midnight 1/1/1970) of the Transaction.

title: ONTRAPORT
description: Enter your App ID and API Key above. If you do not have an App ID or API Key login to your ONTRAPORT account and navigate here. Authentication parameters must be sent in the request header as Api-Appid and Api-Key. Each ONTRAPORT account is allowed up to 180 requests per minute.

methods.description:
This will fetch a Form's HTML for a given ID.
Note: HTML is returned in the data member of the JSON response. As a result, the HTML is escaped and you will have to unescape the HTML before using it.
methods.displayName: This will get an existing Form

methods.description: This will grab the permanent URL for a given Landing Page.
methods.displayName: Grab the hosted URL

methods.description: This will fetch data from an existing Message.

This will update an existing Message

methods.description: This will fetch data for a given Object type and ID.

methods.description: This will delete an Object with the given Object type and ID.

methods.displayName: This will delete a list of Objects

methods.description: This will create an Object with the given data. Object type is a required parameters, but other parameters are optional and dependent upon the object type. We have provided optional parameters as examples for updating a Contact. When using this in your application, all invalid parameters will be ignored.
methods.displayName: This will create an Object

methods.description: This will update an Object's data. The Object type and ID and required parameters, but other parameters are dependent upon the object type. We have provided optional parameters as examples for updating a Contact. When using this in your application, all invalid parameters will be ignored.
methods.displayName: This will update an Object's data

condition.name: condition
condition.description: Apply this condition to the collection query. This is essentially like a SQL WHERE clause, e.g. firstname='Ben'

searchNotes.name: searchNotes
searchNotes.description: Boolean flag to additionally search Object Notes for the Search term given in Search parameter

date_range.name: date_range
date_range.description: Start and End dates to search, in seconds since Jan 1, 1970, as a comma-separated list. Start (index 0 in the array) is inclusive, End (index 1) is exclusive. Either or both can be empty.

group_ids.name: group_ids
group_ids.description: Array of Group ID for Object type as comma-delimited list

methods.description: Get information about an Objects Collection, such as the number of Objects that match the given criteria.
methods.displayName: Get information about an Objects Collection

format.name: format
format.description: Choose to get the list indexed by Object class name or integer ID.

methods.description: This will get a list of existing Object types and their corresponding field names. Use the objectID parameter to This will get a single Object type.
methods.displayName: This will get a list of existing Object types

methods.description: This will create an Object with the given data or will merge with an Object in the database if the unique field matches another Objectâs. Object type is a required parameter, but other parameters are optional and depend on the Object type. We have provided optional parameters as examples for updating a Contact. When using this in your application, all invalid parameters will be ignored.
methods.displayName: Create or Merge an Object

methods.description: This will remove a Tag from an Object using a Tag ID. When adding or removing Tags, either ids or group_ids must be given.
methods.displayName: This will remove an Object Tag

methods.description: This will add a Tag to an Object. when adding or removing Tags, either ids or group_ids must be given.
methods.displayName: This will add an Object Tag

methods.description: To affect a single Task or list of specific Tasks, use the ids array in the criteria parameter. Otherwise, you should use performAll and other criteria to select a Group of Tasks to cancel.
methods.displayName: Cancel a set of Tasks

methods.description: This will mark one or many Tasks as complete. As an option, you can assign a new Task for further follow-up. To affect a single Task or list of specific Tasks, use the ids array in the criteria parameter. Otherwise, you should use performAll and other criteria to select a Group of Tasks to complete.
methods.displayName: Complete a set of Tasks
Convert the status of one or more Transactions to Collections
Convert the status of one or more Transactions to Declined
Mark a Transaction as Paid
Get full information about an order

methods.description: Update information about an Order. Please note that if offer data is omitted, this Order will be deleted.
methods.displayName: Update information about an Order

methods.description: This will create a Transaction for a Contact. Please note that this request requires valid parameters for all associated members of the Transaction or the request will fail. If you have doubled-checked all parameters and the request is still failing, check that the payload JSON format is correct by using JSONLint. If credit card and billing information already exist for this contact, you may omit billing_address and payer from the request. Note that trans_date is given in milliseconds elapsed since midnight on 1/1/1970.
methods.displayName: This will create a new Transaction
Refund one or more Transactions

methods.description: Re-run a single Transaction or a Group of Transactions that are currently in Collections.
methods.displayName: Re-run a Transaction
Re-run a Partner commission
Re-send a Transaction invoice
Void a Transaction
Void a purchase
Write-off a Transaction
